title.narrative: SWE-2011-149 Ecotoxicological Impacts of Pesticide use in Mozambique
SWE-2011-149 Ecotoxicological Impacts of Pesticide use in Mozambique

description.narrative: The aquatic environment is exposed to a variety of pesticides through leakage from agricultural areas often in connection with bad handling and overuse. The main aim of the proposed project is to study the ecotoxicological effects of pesticides in aquatic systems in Mozambique. Focus will be on both fresh water and mangrove environments. Effects of other pollutants on biomarker responses will also be studied. In order to develop ecotoxicological studies and biomonitoring programs in Mozambique the projects also focus on capacity building. The laboratory at the biological department at Eduardo Mondlane University will be provided with equipment necessary for ecotoxicological studies and workshops will be organized giving researchers, master students and technician s hands on experience and teaching.

In order to develop ecotoxicological studies and biomonitoring programs in Mozambique the projects also focus on capacity building. The laboratory at the biological department at Eduardo Mondlane University will be provided with equipment necessary for ecotoxicological studies and workshops will be organized giving researchers, master students and technician s hands on experience and teaching.
